text: hey everyone welcome back to measure and
mix oh thank you so much for stopping by
today if you're new here welcome to my
channel make sure to hit that subscribe
button in the notification bell before
you leave so you don't miss out on
anything new today I am collaborating
with cost from crafting with costs I
love watching her channel she is so
talented and so creative she does all
sorts of different DIYs and she even
does Dollar Tree DIYs and in fact that
is what we are creating for you guys
today is a Dollar Tree spring floral DIY
I seen a picture of what she did and I
think you guys are really going to love
it so make sure you head on over to her
channel and check out her video after
you are done here and show her some love
and support her links are down below in
my description box so like I said I'm
gonna be making a Dollar Tree spring
floral DIY for you guys I'm not exactly
sure what to call this but I hope you
guys like it so let's get started
[Music]
alright to start off I am just making a
window out of these of for picture
frames from Dollar Tree I'm just
removing the plastic setting aside the
glass pieces on each frame and then I
pulled the tabs out of each frame that
held the glass in and then I'm taking my
wrist Oleum linen white chalk paint and
I'm giving each of these frames two
coats of paints front and back
[Music]
next I'm gonna take one of these long
planter boxes from Dollar Tree and I'm
going to give it two coats of the same
linen white chalk paint now that the
frames are dry I'm just gonna take them
and turn them upside down then I'm gonna
take some e6000 and some hot glue and
attach two of the frames together on the
long sides and then reinforce with some
hot glue in the middle of those two
frames and then I'm gonna take the other
two frames and do the same thing and
then I am going to take both those
frames that are attached together and
place some hot glue in some e6000 at the
top and then attach those frames
together like that and reinforce them in
the middle with some more hot glue then
to make this stronger because when you
pick it up it will be flimsy I'm gonna
use these large jumbo sized popsicle
sticks and I am just placing them all
around on the seams of the picture
frames with some hot glue I don't have
any rhyme or reason to this I'm just
trying to make it as secure as possible
so that way when I pick it up it won't
be flimsy and fall over I also use some
smaller popsicle sticks around the top
and bottom and the two sides to
reinforce those
this next part was a little challenging
and needed to figure out how to attach
the planter box to the window frame so
for this I decided to take the planter
box and put it just on the bottom part
of the window frame and then take my
drill with a drill bit and drill through
each corner of the planter box and the
window frame then it took two zip ties
and inserted them through the hole the
picture frame in the hole of the planter
and secured them both together now I
went ahead and stood the piece up and as
you can see the window was still flimsy
so I was holding the piece here and I
decided to put some rocks in the bottom
of the planter so that way it would be
stable while I was working on it and
then while I'm holding the window I am
just putting some hot glue in the seams
between the window and the planter and
then I also am using the smaller
popsicle sticks and just randomly hot
gluing those in between the scenes and
the cracks just to keep everything
together on the backside
[Music]
then after I did the backside it was
still unstable so I went ahead and
turned it around to the front side added
some hot glue to the front side and
added some popsicles in between the
scenes here to hold it all together and
that seemed to do the trick and
everything was stable and you won't be
able to see the zip ties the popsicle
sticks because the flowers are gonna go
there so then I went ahead and took some
floral foam and added that to the bottom
of the planter and took the rest of the
rocks and added that in as well so that
way it would make the planter a little
more heavy so it would stand up better
next I wanted to add something
decorative to the planter box so I had
these leftover wooden letters that I had
gotten from Dollar Tree and I used on
previous projects I had enough to spell
out the words a flower market so I did
that and I just hot glued the wooden
letters down to the box
[Music]
after the letters were all hot glued
down I just took that same white paint
and went over the words after that paint
was dried then I came back with this
weathered gray wood stain and I just
kind of brushed a little bit of it on
the lettering and wiped it off and then
I decided to brush a little bit on the
planter all around and kind of just wipe
it off to give this more of a little bit
of a distressed look I guess so it
wasn't so bright white and then after I
put the gray on I did want to come back
because it was a little too gray in some
spots so I took the white paint and just
kind of dry brushed it over the gray and
I thought this just kind of gave it a
nice little weathered look okay now that
the planter is all finished I'm going to
go ahead and add my floral and I just
picked up some of these white hydrangeas
from Dollar Tree I just added one bunch
to one side here and then I also picked
up some of this lavender the ones with
the white and the purple and I am adding
I think 5 bunches to the middle section
here and then I came back with some more
hydrangeas another bunch and added that
to the other side of the planter and
then I went ahead and took 3 more
bunches of the hydrangeas and just
filled in where I thought it looked bear
at the last thing that I did was take
some of this Spanish moss from Dollar
Tree and just place it around the edges
of the planter so that way you couldn't
see the stems of the flowers and that
was it this is how it turned out I think
it looks really pretty and is perfect
for spring I hope you guys enjoyed this
video make sure to give it a thumbs up
you did and thank you so much to Casas
for collaborating with me onto this
don't forget to check out her video down
below in the description box and that is
it I will see you guys next time take
care bye bye
